intro: Amellus microglossus, commonly known as the small-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and typically grows in rocky or limestone soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually blue or violet in color. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Amellus microglossus is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments.
